content.properties: Hydrogen is the lightest element, highly flammable, and the most abundant in the universe. It exists as diatomic molecules (H₂).
content.uses: Fuel cells, ammonia production, petroleum refining, welding
content.nigerian_context: Hydrogen production from natural gas in Nigerian refineries, potential for clean energy in Lagos.

content.properties: Carbon forms four bonds, basis of organic chemistry. Exists as diamond, graphite, graphene, and amorphous forms.
content.uses: Steel production, electronics, nanotechnology, biological molecules
content.nigerian_context: Carbon in Nigerian crude oil, graphite mining in Niger State, carbon sequestration in Lagos mangroves.

laws.statement: An object at rest stays at rest, and an object in motion stays in motion with the same speed and in the same direction unless acted upon by an unbalanced force.
laws.example: A book on a table remains at rest due to balanced normal and gravitational forces.
A 2kg object accelerating at 3m/s² experiences 6N of force.

laws.statement: For every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction.
laws.example: Rocket propulsion: exhaust gases push down, rocket pushes up.

content.applications: Vehicle design, sports mechanics, structural engineering
content.nigerian_context: Traffic flow in Lagos (Newton's 1st), vehicle acceleration on Nigerian highways (2nd), boat propulsion in Niger Delta (3rd)

content.explanation: Voltage equals current multiplied by resistance. Current is the flow of charge, voltage is electrical potential difference, resistance opposes current flow.

components.resistor: Opposes current flow, measured in ohms (Ω)
components.capacitor: Stores electrical charge, measured in farads (F)
components.inductor: Stores energy in magnetic field, measured in henrys (H)

content.nigerian_context: Household wiring in Nigerian homes, power distribution in PHCN grid, solar panel circuits in rural electrification

cell_types.prokaryotic: No nucleus, smaller, bacteria (e.g., E. coli)
cell_types.eukaryotic: Nucleus present, larger, plants and animals

content.cell_membrane: Selectively permeable barrier controlling substance movement
content.nigerian_context: Malaria parasite (Plasmodium) in red blood cells, cassava plant cells resistant to pests

content.characteristics: Grassland with scattered trees, seasonal rainfall, distinct wet/dry seasons
content.nigerian_context: Northern Nigeria savannas threatened by climate change, importance for cattle rearing and tourism
